  // Reflection helpers to support multiple PubNub SDK major versions without compile-time dependency
  private static Class<?> tryLoadClass(String... candidates) {
    for (String name : candidates) {
      try {
        return Class.forName(name);
      } catch (ClassNotFoundException ignored) {
      }
    }
    return null;
  }

  private static Method findMethod(Class<?> clazz, String name, int paramCount) {
    for (Method m : clazz.getMethods()) {
      if (m.getName().equals(name) && m.getParameterCount() == paramCount) {
        return m;
      }
    }
    throw new RuntimeException(
        "Method not found: " + name + " with " + paramCount + " parameters in " + clazz);
  }

  private static Object invokeNoArg(Object target, String methodName) throws Exception {
    Method m = findMethod(target.getClass(), methodName, 0);
    return m.invoke(target);
  }

  private static Object safeInvokeNoArg(Object target, String methodName) {
    try {
      return invokeNoArg(target, methodName);
    } catch (Exception e) {
      return null;
    }
  }

The build fails after upgrading to Dropwizard 4 because core classes moved packages and the project migrated from javax to jakarta namespaces. Specifically:
- Dropwizard Application, Bootstrap, Environment moved from io.dropwizard.* to io.dropwizard.core.* (and io.dropwizard.core.setup.*).
- JAX-RS Client moved from javax.ws.rs.client.Client to jakarta.ws.rs.client.Client.
- Jackson’s JAX-RS provider moved from com.fasterxml.jackson.jaxrs.json.JacksonJsonProvider to com.fasterxml.jackson.jakarta.rs.json.JacksonJsonProvider.
- Dropwizard configuration utilities likely moved to io.dropwizard.core.configuration.*.

To fix compilation, update imports accordingly. The class and method signatures remain functionally the same, so we don’t change signatures or logic—only imports and types. This should make the types referenced in fields, method parameters, and return types resolve correctly (Application<Config>, Environment, Client). I’ll also proactively switch the configuration imports to the new core package to prevent subsequent compile errors.
</think>

label:
<think>SnakeYAML 2.0 removed the Constructor(Class) constructor and now expects a LoaderOptions instance. The existing call new Constructor(Config.class) fails because the only matching constructor is Constructor(LoaderOptions). To keep type-safe loading, we should: (1) instantiate a LoaderOptions and pass it to the Constructor; (2) load the YAML as the Config class using yaml.loadAs(in, Config.class) instead of casting the result of yaml.load(in). We also need to import org.yaml.snakeyaml.LoaderOptions. Other APIs used (TypeDescription, Yaml) remain compatible for our use here.</think>
